resources.j2c:J2CResourceAdapter.name: WebSphere Relational Resource Adapter
resources.j2c:J2CResourceAdapter.description: Built-in Relational Resource Adapter for Container Managed Persistence

resourceProperties.name: TransactionResourceRegistration
resourceProperties.description: Type of transaction resource registration (enlistment). Valid values are either "static" (immediate) or "dynamic" (deferred).

resourceProperties.name: InactiveConnectionSupport
resourceProperties.description: Specify whether connection handles support implicit reactivation. (Smart Handle support). Value may be "true" or "false".

resourceProperties.name: driverType
resourceProperties.description: The type of the driver. The possible values are: thin, oci8.

resourceProperties.name: oraclelogPrintMask
resourceProperties.description: The oraclelogPrintMask controls which information is printed with each trace message. Oracle9i requires the use of classes12_g.zip. Default is 62 which is ([OracleLog.FIELD_OBJECT for 9i / OracleLog.FIELD_CONN for 8i] 32 | OracleLog.FIELD_CATEGORY 16 | OracleLog.FIELD_SUBMOD 8 | OracleLog.FIELD_MODULE 4 | OracleLog.FIELD_TIME 2). Possible values: OracleLog.FIELD_TIME 2, OracleLog.FIELD_MODULE 4, OracleLog.FIELD_SUBMOD 8, OracleLog.FIELD_CATEGORY 16, OracleLog.FIELD_OBJECT 32, OracleLog.FIELD_THREAD 64

resourceProperties.name: oraclelogModuleMask
resourceProperties.description: The oraclelogModuleMask controls which modules write debug output. Oracle9i requires the use of classes12_g.zip. Default is 1 which is ( OracleLog.MODULE_DRIVER 1). Possible values (OracleLog.MODULE_DRIVER 1, OracleLog.MODULE_DBACCESS 2)

resourceProperties.name: oraclelogCategoryMask
resourceProperties.description: The oraclelogCategoryMask controls which category to be output. Oracle9i requires the use of classes12_g.zip. Default is 47 which is ( OracleLog.USER_OPER 1 | OracleLog.PROG_ERROR 2 | OracleLog.ERROR 4 | OracleLog.WARNING 8 | OracleLog.DEBUG1 32). Possible values (OracleLog.USER_OPER 1, OracleLog.PROG_ERROR 2, OracleLog.ERROR 4, OracleLog.WARNING 8, OracleLog.FUNCTION 16, OracleLog.DEBUG1 32, OracleLog.SQL_STR 128)

resourceProperties.name: TNSEntryName
resourceProperties.description: The entry name which is used for the Oracle OCI driver.

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: Whether to use TCP/IP or IPC or any other protocol

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to sample. used for thin driver setup

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the server. used for thin driver setup

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: The TCP/IP port number where the jdbc driver resides. used for thin driver setup

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: URL
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The URL indicating the database from which the Data Source will obtain connections, such as 'jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:sample' for thin driver and 'jdbc:oracle:oci8:@sample' for thick driver.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect a database. If this value is non-zero, attempt to connect to the database will timeout when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: transactionBranchesLooselyCoupled
resourceProperties.description: This property is introduced as a result of Oraclebug 2511780, Oracle Patch for 2511780 must be installed before setting this property to true, failure to do that would cause a program error. Please check the WebSphere readme file for more info .

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This query string is used for pre-test connection. For example, 'SELECT USER FROM DUAL'. When pre-test connection is enabled in j2c.properties, a statement will be executed with this query to make sure the connection is good. If no query is specified, the default 'SELECT COUNT(*) FROM rra.x1x1x0x4x' will be used.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: DB2 Universal JDBC Driver Provider
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: Non-XA DB2 Universal JDBC Driver-compliant Provider. Datasources created under this provider support only 1-phase commit processing except in the case where driver type 2 is used under WAS z/OS. On WAS z/OS, driver type 2 uses RRS and supports 2-phase commit processing

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. This is an actual database name, and its not the locally catalogued database name. The Universal JDBC Driver does not rely on information catalogued in the DB2 database directory.

resourceProperties.name: driverType
resourceProperties.description: The JDBC connectivity-type of a data source. If you want to use type 4 driver, set the value to 4. If you want to use type 2 driver, set the value to 2.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: The TCP/IP address or host name for the DRDA server. If custom property driverType is set to 4, this property is required.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: The TCP/IP port number where the DRDA server resides. If custom property driverType is set to 4, this property is required.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: traceLevel
resourceProperties.description: The DB2 trace level for logging to the logWriter or trace file. Possible trace levels are: TRACE_NONE = 0,TRACE_CONNECTION_CALLS = 1,TRACE_STATEMENT_CALLS = 2,TRACE_RESULT_SET_CALLS = 4,TRACE_DRIVER_CONFIGURATION = 16,TRACE_CONNECTS = 32,TRACE_DRDA_FLOWS = 64,TRACE_RESULT_SET_META_DATA = 128,TRACE_PARAMETER_META_DATA = 256,TRACE_DIAGNOSTICS = 512,TRACE_SQLJ = 1024,TRACE_ALL = -1, .

resourceProperties.name: traceFile
resourceProperties.description: The trace file to store the trace output.

resourceProperties.name: fullyMaterializeLobData
resourceProperties.description: This setting controls whether or not LOB locators are used to fetch LOB data. If enabled, LOB data is not streamed, but is fully materialized with locators when the user requests a stream on the LOB column. The default value is true.

resourceProperties.name: resultSetHoldability
resourceProperties.description: Determine whether ResultSets are closed or kept open when committing a transaction. The possible values are: 1 (HOLD_CURSORS_OVER_COMMIT), 2 (CLOSE_CURSORS_AT_COMMIT).

resourceProperties.name: currentPackageSet
resourceProperties.description: This property is used in conjunction with the DB2Binder - collection option which is given when the JDBC/CLI packageset is bound during installation by the DBA.

resourceProperties.name: readOnly
resourceProperties.description: This property creates a read only connection. By default this value is false.

resourceProperties.name: deferPrepares
resourceProperties.description: This property provides a performance directive that affects the internal semantics of the input data type conversion capability of the driver. By default the Universal driver defers 'internal prepare requests'. In this case, the driver works without the benefit of described parameter or result set meta data until execute time. So undescsribed input data is sent 'as is' to the server without any data type cross-conversation of the inputs.

resourceProperties.name: currentSchema
resourceProperties.description: Identifies the default schema name used to qualify unqualified database object references where applicable in dynamically prepared SQL statements. Unless currentSchema is used, the default schema name is the authorization id of the current session user.

resourceProperties.name: cliSchema
resourceProperties.description: Indicates the schema of the DB2 shadow catalog tables or views to search when you issue a database meta data catalog query.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: retrieveMessagesFromServerOnGetMessage
resourceProperties.description: Directs all calls to the standard JDBC SQLException.getMessage() to invoke a server-side stored procedure which retrieves the readable message text for the error.

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. This is an actual database name, and its not the locally catalogued database name. The Universal JDBC Driver does not rely on information catalogued in the DB2 database directory.

resourceProperties.name: driverType
resourceProperties.description: The JDBC connectivity-type of a data source. The only permitted value is 2.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: The TCP/IP address or host name for the DRDA server.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: The TCP/IP port number where the DRDA server resides.

resourceProperties.name: enableSQLJ
resourceProperties.description: This value is used to indicate whether SQLJ operations may be performed with this data source. If enabled, this data source can be used for both JDBC and SQLJ calls. Otherwise, only JDBC usage is permitted.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: traceLevel
resourceProperties.description: The DB2 trace level for logging to the logWriter or trace file. Possible trace levels are: TRACE_NONE = 0,TRACE_CONNECTION_CALLS = 1,TRACE_STATEMENT_CALLS = 2,TRACE_RESULT_SET_CALLS = 4,TRACE_DRIVER_CONFIGURATION = 16,TRACE_CONNECTS = 32,TRACE_DRDA_FLOWS = 64,TRACE_RESULT_SET_META_DATA = 128,TRACE_PARAMETER_META_DATA = 256,TRACE_DIAGNOSTICS = 512,TRACE_SQLJ = 1024,TRACE_ALL = -1, .

resourceProperties.name: traceFile
resourceProperties.description: The trace file to store the trace output.

resourceProperties.name: fullyMaterializeLobData
resourceProperties.description: This setting controls whether or not LOB locators are used to fetch LOB data. If enabled, LOB data is not streamed, but is fully materialized with locators when the user requests a stream on the LOB column. The default value is true.

resourceProperties.name: resultSetHoldability
resourceProperties.description: Determine whether ResultSets are closed or kept open when committing a transaction. The possible values are: 1 (HOLD_CURSORS_OVER_COMMIT), 2 (CLOSE_CURSORS_AT_COMMIT).

resourceProperties.name: currentPackageSet
resourceProperties.description: This property is used in conjunction with the DB2Binder - collection option which is given when the JDBC/CLI packageset is bound during installation by the DBA.

resourceProperties.name: readOnly
resourceProperties.description: This property creates a read only connection. By default this value is false.

resourceProperties.name: deferPrepares
resourceProperties.description: This property provides a performance directive that affects the internal semantics of the input data type conversion capability of the driver. By default the Universal driver defers 'internal prepare requests'. In this case, the driver works without the benefit of described parameter or result set meta data until execute time. So undescsribed input data is sent 'as is' to the server without any data type cross-conversation of the inputs.

resourceProperties.name: currentSchema
resourceProperties.description: Identifies the default schema name used to qualify unqualified database object references where applicable in dynamically prepared SQL statements. Unless currentSchema is used, the default schema name is the authorization id of the current session user.

resourceProperties.name: cliSchema
resourceProperties.description: Indicates the schema of the DB2 shadow catalog tables or views to search when you issue a database meta data catalog query.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: retrieveMessagesFromServerOnGetMessage
resourceProperties.description: Directs all calls to the standard JDBC SQLException.getMessage() to invoke a server-side stored procedure which retrieves the readable message text for the error.

resourceProperties.description: The oraclelogPrintMask controls which information is printed with each trace message. Oracle9i requires the use of classes12_g.zip. Default is 62 which is ([OracleLog.FIELD_OBJECT for 9i / OracleLog.FIELD_CONN for 8i] 32 | OracleLog.FIELD_CATEGORY 16 | OracleLog.FIELD_SUBMOD 8 | OracleLog.FIELD_MODULE 4 | OracleLog.FIELD_TIME 2). Possible values (OracleLog.USER_OPER 1, OracleLog.PROG_ERROR 2, OracleLog.ERROR 4, OracleLog.WARNING 8, OracleLog.FUNCTION 16, OracleLog.DEBUG1 32, OracleLog.SQL_STR 128)

resourceProperties.name: TNSEntryName
resourceProperties.description: The entry name which is used for the Oracle OCI driver.

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: Whether to use TCP/IP or IPC or any other protocol

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to sample, used with thin driver

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the server, used with thin driver setup

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: The TCP/IP port number where the jdbc driver resides. used with thin driver setup

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: URL
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The URL indicating the database from which the Data Source will obtain connections, such as 'jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:sample' for thin driver and 'jdbc:oracle:oci8:@sample' for thick driver.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect a database. If this value is non-zero, attempt to connect to the database will timeout when this specified value is reached.
